Body:
Description: Hi, I was recently tidying up a server before preparing to migrate it to a new instance with the updated OVF file. I have backed up and deleted all Audit Logs older than one month, cleared old computers not seen in the last month and removed thousands of old users. However it does not seem to have made any difference to the backup size which is around 400MB.

When dealing with our last issue, Alin mentioned that our backups are too big to do the migration alone, so can we have some advice how to meaningfully reduce these, and also request assistance with the migration. We have successfully the deployed the new version and it is waiting to accept the backup.

Many Thanks,
Pete
What We've Learned Updated: The backup of the old server is larger than 400 mb, which is the upload limit on the new server.
Next Steps Updated: A remote session will be scheduled in order to increase the upload limit on the new server and then to import the backup.
Next Steps Updated: The limit for the backups was increased during the remote session, waiting for the customer to finish the migration process and update if the ticket can be closed.
Next Steps Updated: Waiting for the customer to import the SSL Certificate.
Invitation updated. Attendees: No attendees listed
Invitation updated. Attendees: Emil Podar, Pete Taylor
